p: The coronavirus disease-2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has taken a heavy toll on the healthcare system across the world. With a global incidence of over six million, the mortality rate so far has been approximately 6.5% [ 1]. Though a few countries have succeeded in containing the spread of the virus, the overall incidence of fresh infections is still on the rise. Moreover, with no vaccine or definitive treatment in sight [ 2], the health care systems across the world are strained and are staring at an uncertain future and a long-term coexistence of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) with the human host has been anticipated.
